CONJUGATES: south (noun singular) | souths (noun plural, rare) | south (adverb) | southern (adjective derived)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English sūþ, from Proto-Germanic *sunþraz (perhaps related to *sunnō 'sun', indicating the direction of the sun at noon in the northern hemisphere).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: One of the four cardinal points of the compass, specifically 180° clockwise from north; the direction in which the sun is found at noon in the northern hemisphere.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 指南针的四个基本方向之一，与北方相对，位于北方的180°顺时针方向；北半球正午时太阳所在的方向。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The birds migrate to the south for the winter.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 鸟儿们冬天迁徙到南方。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The southern part of a country, continent, or region, often referring to areas with distinct cultural or historical characteristics (e.g., the Southern United States or the Global South).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个国家、大陆或地区的南部，常指具有独特文化或历史特征的区域（例如美国南部或全球南方）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She grew up in the South of France.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Located in, directed towards, or originating from the south.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 位于南方、面向南方或来自南方的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The south wind brought warmer weather.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 南风带来了温暖的天气。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We drove south until we reached the coast.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们一路向南开车，直到抵达海岸。
